alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A developing thunderstorm with gusty winds will impact portions of west central Pittsylvania, eastern Henry and southeastern Franklin Counties and the City of Martinsville through 130 PM EDT... At 103 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm developing near Martinsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Axton... Ridgeway... Snow Creek... Leatherwood... Villa Heights... and Chatmoss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
